item.title: 美股可能没有泡沫，但回调可能近在眼前
item.description: 一些市场人士认为，尽管目前仍不清楚股市是处于泡沫还是强劲牛市，但美国股市的无情上涨已准备好喘息。【原文：Some market participants believe the relentless U.S. stock rally is poised for a breather, even if it remains unclear whether equities are in a bubble or a strong bull run.】

item.title: 市场：结束银行 "窗口指导 "的举措或将重塑美国回购市场
item.description: 全球监管机构建议改变最大的银行在年底报告关键风险指标的方式，这可能会对它们在美国的短期融资业务造成打击，这也是收紧资本规则之战的最新一炮。【原文：A proposal by global regulators to change how the largest banks report key risk metrics at the end of the year could deal a blow to their U.S. short-term funding businesses, the latest salvo in a battle over tighter capital rules.】

item.title: 国泰航空四年来首次实现年度盈利
item.description: 香港国泰航空公司（Cathay Pacific Airways）周三公布了2023年97.9亿港元（12.5亿美元）的盈利报告，这是该公司四年来首次实现年度盈利，并表示其目标是在今年第二季度内达到疫情前客运航班的80%。【原文：Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways reported on Wednesday a HK$9.79 billion ($1.25 billion) profit for 2023, its first annual profit in four years, and said it aims to reach 80% of its pre-pandemic passenger flights within the second quarter of this year.】

item.title: 澳大利亚普华永道因税务计划泄露丑闻再裁员 300 多人
item.description: 普华永道澳大利亚公司周三表示，该公司将再裁员 329 人，这是继一名前合伙人泄露政府税收计划的全国性丑闻之后进行的重大重组的一部分。【原文：PwC Australia on Wednesday said it would cut an additional 329 jobs, part of a major restructuring that follows a national scandal in which a former partner leaked government tax plans.】

item.title: 股市超越美国通胀率，创下里程碑式新高
item.description: 在华尔街创下历史最高纪录的背景下，亚洲股市周三创下七个月来的新高，原因是投资者大多对美国通胀略高于预期的情况不以为然，并押注这不会破坏今年年中降息的预期。【原文：Asian shares notched seven month highs on Wednesday, on the back of record peaks on Wall Street, as investors mostly shrugged off slightly hotter-than-expected U.S. inflation, betting it won't derail interest rate cuts expected by the middle of the year.】

item.title: 中国电动车巨头比亚迪推出起售价更低的新版 e2 掀背车
item.description: 中国电动汽车巨头比亚迪周三推出了新版 e2 电动掀背车，起售价低于上一代车型。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD on Wednesday launched a new version of e2 EV hatchback with a lower starting price than its predecessor.】

item.title: 交易员权衡通胀热度高于预期，美元走稳
item.description: 周三，美元兑几种主要货币持稳，因为交易员们在权衡比预期更热的通胀数据会对美联储在 6 月份会议上降息的可能性产生何种影响。【原文：The U.S. dollar held steady against a handful of rival currencies on Wednesday, as traders weighed what impact hotter-than-expected inflation data could have on chances of an interest rate cut at the Federal Reserve's June meeting.】

item.title: 零售商沃尔玛将在 2024 年投资约 20 亿美元
item.description: 据周二公布的一份文件显示，墨西哥零售商沃尔玛将在 2024 年投资约 345 亿比索（约合 20.5 亿美元），同比增长 19%。【原文：Mexican retailer Walmex is set to invest around 34.5 billion pesos ($2.05 billion) in 2024, up 19% from previous year, according to a filing published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 油价因美国需求强劲而上涨，美联储信号受关注
item.description: 油价周三上涨，原因是市场预期全球需求强劲，包括世界第一大消费国美国的需求，而且即使美国通胀略显疲软，也没有削弱美联储可能很快开始降息的预期。【原文：Oil prices rose on Wednesday on expectations of strong global demand, including in the world's top consumer the United States, and as even somewhat sticky U.S. inflation did not dent expectations the Fed might start cutting rates soon.】

item.title: KKR 将向菲律宾电信塔业务投资 4 亿美元
item.description: 美国商务部周三表示，私募股权公司 KKR & Co 将投资 4 亿美元用于菲律宾电信塔的运营和扩张，这是在一个具有里程碑意义的贸易代表团中宣布的 10 亿美元投资中的一系列交易之一。【原文：Private equity firm KKR & Co will invest $400 million in telecoms tower operations and expansion in the Philippines, the U.S. Department of Commerce said on Wednesday, among a slew of deals in a $1 billion investment announced in a landmark trade mission.】

item.title: 2023 年全球企业红利将达到创纪录的 1.66 万亿美元
item.description: 周三的一份报告显示，2023 年全球企业红利将达到 1.66 万亿美元，创历史新高，其中银行创纪录的派息占增长额的一半。【原文：Corporate dividends globally hit an all-time high of $1.66 trillion in 2023, with record payouts by banks making up half of the growth, a report showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 二月份全球电动汽车销量受中国新年庆祝活动影响
item.description: 市场研究公司Rho Motion周三表示，2月份全球全电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车（PHEV）的销量与去年同期相比增长了3%，增幅不高，主要原因是受到中国农历新年庆祝活动的影响。【原文：Global sales of fully electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles (PHEVs) rose at a tepid rate of 3% in February versus the same period last year mainly due to the impact of the Chinese Lunar New Year celebrations, market research firm Rho Motion said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 丰田可能同意工资要求，日本公司将大幅提高薪酬
item.description: 日本《每日新闻》周三称，丰田汽车公司已同意完全满足工会提出的年度加薪要求。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp has agreed to fully meet its union's request for annual pay increases, the Mainichi newspaper said on Wednesday, as top Japanese companies look likely to offer sizeable salary hikes at annual talks with unions.】

item.title: 气候变化使时装季节性减弱，Mango 作出调整
item.description: 西班牙零售商 Mango 首席执行官托尼-鲁伊斯（Toni Ruiz）告诉路透社记者，随着气候变化使时装的季节性减弱，Mango 正在开发适应性强的服装，以帮助顾客适应气温的剧烈波动。【原文：Spanish retailer Mango is honing in on adaptable clothing to help customers adjust to wild swings in temperature as climate change makes fashion less seasonal, Chief Executive Toni Ruiz told Reuters.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，随着人工智能芯片竞赛进入白热化，三星将采用 SK 海力士青睐的芯片制造技术
item.description: 五位人士表示，三星电子计划采用竞争对手 SK 海力士倡导的芯片制造技术，这家全球顶级内存芯片制造商正努力在生产用于人工智能的高端芯片的竞争中迎头赶上。【原文：Samsung Electronics plans to use a chip making technology championed by rival SK Hynix, five people said, as the world's top memory chipmaker seeks to catch up in the race to produce high-end chips used to power artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 早间投标科技股的弹性与债券收益率的胶着
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: Equinix 聘请 Google 云计算公司高管担任首席执行官
item.description: 数据中心运营商 Equinix 周二任命 Alphabet 旗下谷歌云公司高管 Adaire Fox-Martin 为其首席执行官，任命将于下季度末生效。【原文：Data center operator Equinix on Tuesday named Alphabet's Google Cloud executive Adaire Fox-Martin as its CEO, with the appointment effective late next quarter.】

item.title: 通用汽车负责软件和服务的执行副总裁 Mike Abbott 将卸任
item.description: 通用汽车公司周二表示，由于健康原因，迈克-阿博特（Mike Abbott）将辞去软件与服务执行副总裁一职。【原文：General Motors said on Tuesday that Mike Abbott will step down as executive vice president, software and services, due to health reasons.】

item.title: 华尔街关注首次公开募股锁定期到期，Arm 公司股价上涨
item.description: 周二，软银集团支持的英国芯片设计公司Arm Holdings股价上涨1.6%，至128.77美元，原因是该公司与首次公开募股（IPO）相关的锁定期结束后，市场为交易活动的增加做好了准备。【原文：Shares of Arm Holdings , the British chip designer backed by Softbank Group , gained 1.6% to $128.77 on Tuesday as markets braced for increased trading activity following the expiration of the lockup period tied to its blockbuster initial public offering (IPO).】

item.title: 备忘录称波音将在 737 工厂增加合规检查和设备审核
item.description: 波音公司（BA.N）周二在给员工的一份备忘录中说，公司将增加每周对每个 737 工作区的合规性检查，并增加对设备的审核，以减少质量问题。【原文：Boeing BA.N is adding weekly compliance checks for every 737 work area and additional audits of equipment to reduce quality problems, the company said in a memo to employees on Tuesday.】

item.title: 2024 年和 2025 年美国电力使用量将创历史新高 -EIA
item.description: 美国能源信息署（EIA）在本周二发布的《短期能源展望》（STEO）报告中称，2024年和2025年美国的电力消耗量将创下历史新高。【原文：U.S. power consumption will rise to record highs in 2024 and 2025, the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) said in its Short Term Energy Outlook (STEO) on Tuesday.】

item.title: 卡车司机工会与拜登会面，计划在今年夏天做出支持决定
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）周二与拥有 130 万会员的国际卡车司机兄弟会（International Brotherhood of Teamsters）的领导人举行了会谈，六周前他的共和党竞争对手唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）曾与该工会会面，寻求他们的支持。【原文：U.S. President Joe Biden on Tuesday sat down with leaders of the 1.3 million-member International Brotherhood of Teamsters, six weeks after his Republican rival Donald Trump met with the union to seek their endorsement.】

item.title: 特斯拉官员谈东南亚扩张，中国比亚迪遥遥领先
item.description: 特斯拉一位高管周二表示，特斯拉的首要任务是向东南亚扩张，并强调了这个快速增长的市场，这家美国电动汽车制造商面临着来自中国比亚迪的竞争。【原文：Tesla's expansion into Southeast Asia is a priority, a senior executive said on Tuesday, highlighting the fast-growing market where the U.S. electric-vehicle maker faces competition from China's BYD.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称伊坎放弃挑战 Illumina 董事会的威胁
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，激进投资者卡尔-伊坎（Carl Icahn）已经放弃了向 Illumina 董事会发起新挑战的威胁，从而使这家美国基因测序公司免于多年来的第二次代理权争夺。【原文：Activist investor Carl Icahn has dropped a threat to mount a new challenge to Illumina's board, sparing the U.S. gene sequencing company from its second proxy contest in as many years, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Geico 不会面临集体诉讼索赔，因为它在大流行病期间向司机多收费用
item.description: 一名联邦法官周二裁定，沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）旗下的汽车保险公司 Geico 将不会面临集体诉讼索赔，因为该公司将对一项指控其在 COVID-19 大流行早期向投保人多收费的诉讼进行抗辩。【原文：Geico, the car insurer owned by Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway , will not face class-action claims as it defends against a lawsuit alleging it overcharged policyholders early in the COVID-19 pandemic, a federal judge ruled on Tuesday.】

item.title: 洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔表示，国营墨西哥航空公司将在 10 月前购买 20 架飞机
item.description: 墨西哥国有航空公司墨西哥航空公司（Mexicana）领导人周二告诉记者，该公司将在今年 10 月总统安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔（Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador）任期结束时购买 20 架飞机。【原文：Mexico's state-owned airline Mexicana will purchase 20 aircraft by October, when President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador's term ends, the country's leader told reporters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 通用汽车称其生产的约 20,000 辆电动汽车不符合税收抵免条件
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周三表示，底特律汽车制造商今年生产了约2万辆不符合电动汽车税收抵免条件的电动汽车，在供应链发生变化后才重新获得抵免。【原文：General Motors said Wednesday the Detroit automaker built about 20,000 electric vehicles this year that did not qualify for EV tax credits before regaining access after supply chain changes.】

item.title: 地产投资商拉萨尔称欧洲 30% 的办公空间可能 "过时
item.description: 拉萨尔投资管理公司（LaSalle Investment Management）欧洲区负责人周二表示，该公司正在减少对欧洲写字楼的投资，并认为该地区 20% 至 30% 的写字楼空间可能已经 "过时"。【原文：LaSalle Investment Management is reducing its exposure to offices in Europe and believes between 20% and 30% of office space in the region could be "obsolete", the firm's head of Europe said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 价格下跌后，美国开发商 Greystar 瞄准法国和德国
item.description: 美国房地产公司 Greystar 的执行董事周二告诉路透社，该公司预计今年将在欧洲房地产上花费超过 14 亿欧元（15.3 亿美元），因为它希望抓住法国和德国近期房价下跌的机会。【原文：U.S. property firm Greystar expects to spend more than 1.4 billion euros ($1.53 billion) on European real estate this year as it looks to seize on recent price falls in France and Germany, its executive director told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 波音公司 2 月份喷气客机交付量降至 27 架
item.description: 波音公司（Boeing Co）周二表示，该公司 2 月份交付了 27 架飞机，比去年同期减少了一架。【原文：Boeing Co said on Tuesday it had delivered 27 airplanes in February, down one unit from the same month a year ago, as the U.S. planemaker faces curbs on production growth.】
